|Item_parent_short=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105)
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the non-cardiac and non-neurological causes of malaise
|Description=including somatomorphic malaise, panic attack
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=
|Order=9}}
HAS

"Malaise without loss of consciousness": falls, catalepsy, drops attacks, psychogenic pseudo syncope

"Malaise with partial or total loss of consciousness: metabolic disorders including hypoglycaemia, hypoxia, intoxication, etc.

question.title: What is a non-cardiac and non-neurological cause of malaise?

option_a.title: Falls
option_a.description: A type of accident that can cause loss of consciousness

option_b.title: Catalepsy
option_b.description: A condition characterized by immobility and rigidity

option_c.title: Psychogenic pseudo syncope
option_c.description: A condition caused by a psychological factor, leading to a brief loss of consciousness

option_d.title: Hypoglycaemia
option_d.description: A metabolic disorder that can cause loss of consciousness
